title: 113_hr1324
content: The "Workforce Development Tax Credit Act of 2013" allows for a credit for wages paid to employees in qualified apprenticeship programs under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Workforce Development Tax Credit Act of 2013" provides an apprenticeship credit under section 38 of the Internal Revenue Code. The credit consists of the apprenticeship period credit and the post-apprenticeship credit. The apprenticeship period credit is 50% of wages paid to apprenticeship employees during a qualified training year. The post-apprenticeship credit allows for a 40% credit on wages paid to employees who completed a qualified training program, limited to $6,000 per year per apprenticeship employee. The post-apprenticeship credit limits wages to $6,000 per year for apprenticeship employees who complete a qualified training program. Definitions for wages, apprenticeship employee, and qualified training year are provided. The qualified training program requires 28 consecutive weeks of training and 8 credit hours of classroom work per semester. The training period begins when the employee starts as an apprentice under the program. The training period begins when the employee starts as an apprentice under the program. The amount of credit allowable under certain sections will be reduced by the credit allowed under this section for each employee. Rules similar to those of section 51 will apply for this credit. Section 38 of the Code is amended to include a new apprenticeship credit under section 45S(a). Subsection (a) of section 280C is also amended to prevent double benefits. Additionally, a clerical amendment is made to the table of sections. The amendments made by this section apply to individuals starting apprenticeship programs after the enactment of this Act.
